text: Thank you for reporting! Just spun up an issue to look into this more here (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/issues/405>)

modules can’t be nested inside of other modules. There are some tricks some developers use by using macros and imports, that kind of emulates this.

Additionally you could consider creating smaller modules like a button module, and using it within a reusable section. Then you can use those smaller pieces in a reusable way across many pages etc.

Then for any situations that doesn’t solve for you can still create a larger module that just includes some of those smaller pieces.

In addition to what <@U7SL518D6> mentioned, I've found success in creating 'templated' groups/markup that can be used across modules. For example, if you know that a button requires the same fields you can create a `button` group(s) of JSON and copy/paste across modules. Similarly, you can do the same for markup.
